comment: This is the land-sea mask of the W5E5 dataset ([Cucchi et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-2097-2020); [Lange et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.342217)). Over all grid cells marked as land by this mask, all climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. For further information see also <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/41/>.
Same as **landseamask** but without Antarctica.

This is the generic land-sea mask from ISIMIP2b that is to be used for global water simulations in ISIMIP3. It marks more grid cells as land than **landseamask**. Over those additional land cells, the climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are not guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. Instead they may represent climate conditions over sea or a mix of conditions over land and sea.
Country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.
Fractional country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.

One fixed pattern to be used for all simulation periods. Upscaled Soil texture map (30 arc sec. to 0.5°x0.5° grid) based on Harmonized World Soil Database v1.1 (HWSD, <https://www.fao.org/publications/card/en/c/2fa14e5e-ae97-516e-9dd2-24bc7abbc823/>) using the GSWP3 upscaling method A (<http://hydro.iis.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~sujan/research/gswp3/soil-texture-map.html>)

variables.long_name: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)

comment: GGCMI Phase 3 soil input data set for usage in ISIMIP/GGCMI Phase 3 simulations, data aggregated by dominant soil profile (MU_GLOBAL) within dominant soil texture class from HWSD on all land.

variables.long_name: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)

comment: GGCMI Phase 3 soil input data set for usage in ISIMIP/GGCMI Phase 3 simulations, data aggregated by dominant soil profile (MU_GLOBAL) within dominant soil texture class from HWSD on current cropland ([MIRCA2000 at 5 arc-minutes](https://doi.org/10.1029/2008GB003435)).

title: basins
comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

title: flowdir
comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

title: slopes
comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

title: Hypsographic: Volume
comment: Level-Volume Hypsographic curves to be provided to your model (alternatively, you can also use the Level-Volume Hypsographic curves). Each hypsographic consist in 11 data pairs. Level refers to the level of the lake taking the lake bottom as the reference (in meters), Volume is the volume at the corresponding level (in km3). Calculated from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603>)). More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Hypsographic: Area
comment: Level-Area Hypsographic curves to be provided to your model (alternatively, you can also use the Level-Volume Hypsographic curves). Each hypsographic consist in 11 data pairs. Level refers to the level of the lake taking the lake bottom as the reference (in meters), Area is the area at the corresponding level (in km2). Calculated from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603>)). More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Lake Heigth
comment: Elevation (meters above sea level) for representative lakes calculated from Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)). More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Maximum lake depth
comment: Maximum depth (meters) for representative lakes calculated from from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)). We recommend using the area or volume hypsographic curves provided in this repository as inputs for your lake model. Use this file only if your lake model does not accept a full hypsographic curve as an input. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Mean lake depth
comment: Mean depth (meters) for representative lakes calculated from from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)). We recommend using the area or volume hypsographic curves provided in this repository as inputs for your lake model. Use this file only if your lake model does not accept a full hypsographic curve as an input. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Lake Surface Area
comment: Surface area (km^2) for representative lakes calculated from from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)). We recommend using the area or volume hypsographic curves as inputs for your lake model. Use this file only if your lake model does not accept a full hypsographic curve as an input. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Lake Volume
comment: Volume (km^3) for representative lakes calculated from from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)). We recommend using the area or volume hypsographic curves as inputs for your lake model. Use this file only if your lake model does not accept a full hypsographic curve as an input. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: HydroLAKES ID for big lakes
comment: File provided for reference, to relate Hydrolakes and GLOBathy database fields to the representative lakes. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Biglakes mask
comment: File provided for reference, to produce global plots with conspicuous large lakes during figure production. To be used together with the file storing the big lakes IDs. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: HydroLAKES ID
comment: File provided for reference, to produce global plots with conspicuous large lakes during figure production. To be used together with the file storing the big lakes mask. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Sea Floor Depth
comment: Grid cell level ocean depth GFDL-MOM6-COBALT2 was running with.
